import React from "react"; import ReactDOM from "react-dom"; import Hello from "./Hello"; import BalticCountries from "./BalticCountries"; import Countries from "./Countries"; import "./styles.css"; import Weather from "./Weather"; import ReactAnimatedWeather from "react-animated-weather"; import "./App.css"; function App() { let countries = [ { name: "France", capital: "Paris" }, { name: "USA", capital: "Washinton.D.C", }, { name: "Australia", capital: "Canberra" }, ]; return (
Week3 Less2

React Conditional Rendering

Challenge 1

Create a new Component Hello return a h2 with the word "Hello" in it. Include the component here.

{/* HelloHello */}

Challenge 2

Send a property language and the component should render "Bonjour" if language is french and "Hello" in other cases. Include the component here for English and French

{/* BonjourHello HelloHello */}

Challenge 3

Add the ability for the component to render "Hola" for Spanish. Include the component here for Spanish

{/* HelloHalo */} Week3 Less3

React Loops

Challenge 1

Create a new Component called BalticCountries and list the 3 baltic countries (Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania) without using loops or variables. Include the component below.

{/* Estonia Latvia Lithuania */}

Challenge 2

Include a component called Countries below and send the variable countries (created above) as a property. Create a new component called Countries and list all countries from the Countries component using a loop.

Challenge 3

Modify the countries variable in the code above so it includes the country name but also the capital city of each country. Display each country and capital city in the Countries component

{/* The capital city of France is Paris The capital city of USA is Washinton.D.C The capital city of Australia is Canberra */} Week3 Less4

React AJAX

Challenge 1

Import axios

Challenge 2

Create a new component called Weather with a city property which returns an h1 with the sentence "The temperature in city is something°C". Include it here

{/* The Weather in Sydney is 21°C The Weather in Lisbon is 15°C */}

Challenge 3

Use the OpenWeather API to get the city temperature in Celsius

Week3 Less5

React External Components

Challenge 1

Import and render this component{" "} https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-animated-weather


Challenge 2

Display 3 different icons and change the properties for each of them{" "}
